examples.title: Hello World
examples.description: Basic input/output - Press I0.0 to control Q0.0

examples.title: Multiple Outputs
examples.description: Control multiple outputs with different inputs

examples.title: AND Logic - Safety Circuit
examples.description: Two-hand safety control using AND logic

examples.title: OR Logic - Multiple Buttons
examples.description: Multiple start buttons using OR logic

examples.title: LD - Load
examples.description: Loads the value into the accumulator

examples.title: LDN - Load Negated
examples.description: Loads the negated value into the accumulator

examples.title: ST - Store
examples.description: Stores the accumulator value to output

examples.title: STN - Store Negated
examples.description: Stores the negated accumulator value to output

examples.title: AND - AND Logic
examples.description: Performs AND operation with accumulator

examples.title: ANDN - AND Negated
examples.description: Performs AND operation with negated input

examples.title: OR - OR Logic
examples.description: Performs OR operation with accumulator

examples.title: ORN - OR Negated
examples.description: Performs OR operation with negated input

examples.title: TON - Timer On-Delay
examples.description: Output activates after a delay when input is ON

examples.title: TOFF - Timer Off-Delay
examples.description: Output stays ON for a delay after input turns OFF

examples.title: CTU - Counter Up
examples.description: Counts up each time input transitions from OFF to ON

examples.title: CTD - Counter Down
examples.description: Counts down from preset value to 0

examples.title: Start/Stop with Seal
examples.description: Motor control with latching (seal-in)

examples.title: Timer On-Delay (TON)
examples.description: 5-second delay before output activation

examples.title: Timer Off-Delay (TOFF)
examples.description: Output stays on for 3 seconds after input release

examples.title: Blinker / Flasher
examples.description: Creates a blinking output (1Hz)

examples.title: Counter Up (CTU)
examples.description: Count up to 5, then activate output

examples.title: Counter Down (CTD)
examples.description: Count down from 10 to 0

examples.title: Traffic Light - Single
examples.description: Single traffic light cycle (Red→Green→Yellow)

examples.title: Batch Process - Manual Control
examples.description: Manual tank filling, mixing, and draining with START/STOP buttons

examples.title: Batch Process - Fully Automatic
examples.description: Complete automatic cycle: Fill → Mix (5s) → Drain with single START button

examples.title: Batch Process - Overflow Detection
examples.description: Error handling: detects overflow/spill if filling takes >12s, triggers alarm and emergency drain

examples.title: Traffic Light - Crossroad (2 Lights)
examples.description: Two independent traffic lights for a crossroad intersection

examples.title: Traffic Light - Safe Crossroad
examples.description: Synchronized traffic lights with collision prevention logic

examples.title: SWITCH - Basic
examples.description: Simple toggle button: click to turn ON/OFF

examples.title: SWITCH - AND Logic
examples.description: Two switches in series: both ON to activate output

examples.title: SWITCH - OR Logic
examples.description: Two switches in parallel: either one activates output

examples.title: NO - Basic
examples.description: Momentary button: active only while held

examples.title: NO - START/STOP
examples.description: Seal-in circuit: START turns ON, STOP turns OFF

examples.title: NO - Counter
examples.description: Counts button presses up to 5

examples.title: NC - Basic
examples.description: Inverted button: TRUE when not pressed

examples.title: NC - STOP Fail-Safe
examples.description: Safe STOP: broken wire = motor stops

examples.title: NC - Safety Circuit
examples.description: Two NC in series for dual protection

examples.title: Mixed Button Types
examples.description: SWITCH + NO + NC working together

examples.title: Compressor — Operação Básica (1 Máquina)
examples.description: Apenas compressor A: START/STOP, controle por PE com AND/OR/ANDN. Dica: Flow 100% tende a estabilizar; <100% acelera subida de PSI.

examples.title: Compressor — Alternância por Contador (CTU)
examples.description: Alterna A/B a cada ciclo de baixa pressão com CTU; exclusividade garantida. Dica: Flow entre 50% e 80% favorece ciclos naturais.

examples.title: Compressor — Alternância Temporizada (TON/TOFF)
examples.description: A liga; após 5s B habilita (TON). Ao desligar, B mantém 3s (TOFF). Dica: Use Flow 100% para observar claramente a sequência A→B e a cauda do TOFF.
